TopicTitle: [1.5.x] Asclepius - A Kopernicus planet - SSTO playground

Articles.Content:
> 
> 
> 1 minute ago, MrChumley said:
> 
> 
> No weird settings... ![:/](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/ZNGIcon1.png ":/") I just right click and create archive.   Linux 17.1
> 

there must be something about the standard linux settings that is not compatible with the plugin I use to extract zips then >\_>
I really wish there was something I could do for ya.  Everything works on my end.

Sorry for necropost, but I love this mod and I don't know what else to do.

Asclepius seems to work fine in 1.4, but for some reason Kruel looks roughly 2.5 times larger (everything is still the same, it still reads 60km radius and gravity is the same, it's diameter looks almost as wide as Asclepius'), and it's terrain sort-of dissapears when you're descending to it's surface, revealing a barren ball. It's a very wierd bug and I can't explain it any better.

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, sslaptnhablhat said:
> 
> 
> Sorry for necropost, but I love this mod and I don't know what else to do.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Asclepius seems to work fine in 1.4, but for some reason Kruel looks roughly 2.5 times larger (everything is still the same, it still reads 60km radius and gravity is the same, it's diameter looks almost as wide as Asclepius'), and it's terrain sort-of dissapears when you're descending to it's surface, revealing a barren ball. It's a very wierd bug and I can't explain it any better.
> 

I ran into the same bug in KSP 1.4.2, and was not able to fix it.

So, my solution: just delete all files related to Kruel, effectively removing it from the game. Yes, it's a shame, that Asclepius doesn't have a moon in my install, but...
Is this compatible with 1.4.x? Are there plans to make it so? Can there be a 2nd moon? @MrChumley

I finally gave in and updated to 1.4.5 ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")I've been fiddling with Kruel trying to get it to work. 

I don't think I'm going to get it to work the same way I did last time just re-using Ike's textures.  So I've decided to just start from (mostly) scratch.

So Far:

![RfwzES3.png](https://i.imgur.com/RfwzES3.png)

from the ground:

![SfHZA4n.png](https://i.imgur.com/SfHZA4n.png)

I'll have an Asclepius v1.4 for everyone soon™ .

Great news!

I am planning a couple of missions to Asclepius in my current career game, it would be nice to make a visit to Kruel too.
What to say, what to say... WOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO

Ahoy Kerbalnauts!

Just stopping by to let everyone know that I'm (almost done) working on localization for Asclepius (along with Kronkus, and Spud) so that the custom science definitions work again.  :)

UPDATE COMING SOON!

[@MrChumley](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/58555-mrchumley/)  I was having trouble getting the clouds to work, until I looked into ASCclouds.cfg and realized that I needed the original <abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr> configs as well as the basic mod. Since there are now a number of config sets for <abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr> in addition to the original, and since you can really only use one config at a time, perhaps the need for the BoulderCo configs should be noted on the <abbr title="1. Original Post(er). The first post in a thread, or the person who posted it. 2. Overpowered. A part or mechanic that upsets game balance by being too powerful.">OP</abbr>?

A part or mechanic that upsets game balance by being too powerful.">OP</abbr>.  I'm considering removing the ASCclouds.cfg altogether for the next release.  It seems to be causing more problems than helping.

As a side note: if anyone wants to help with getting Asclepius to work more seamlessly with SVE, Scatterer, etc...  I'd be very grateful.  I found a program that generates these configs awhile ago, but they were Windows only, and I run Linux.
World this pack be able to run KSP 1.7.3?

I'm not a modder and have no idea how to implement it, but is seems that this is still replacing the stock <abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)"><abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr></abbr> files with the Asclepius cloud files.  Is there a way that you can specify to <abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)"><abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr></abbr> that the Asclepius cloud file needs to only be used on that planet? Would love to add this to my universe, but it breaks <abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)"><abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr></abbr>.  I am using the latest <abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)"><abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr></abbr> from <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)"><abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr></abbr> and KSP 12.3.1. I don't think it interferes with scatterer, at least not on my setup. Thank you very much for the mod though.
I'm having trouble finding the Gooba Flats. The biome map is a bit perplexing
